skill.name: design-component
skill.description: Design Component skill for Empathy Ledger. Use for storyteller cards, story cards, profile displays, and any UI component requiring cultural sensitivity. Provides data mapping, AI enrichment patterns, and design system guidelines.
skill.summary: Design Component skill for Empathy Ledger. Use for storyteller cards, story cards, profile displays,...
skill.author: Acurioustractor

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown files with design guidelines. No executable code, scripts, network calls, filesystem access, or environment variable reads. The skill operates entirely as a prompt-based guidance system.

content.value_statement: Build accessible storyteller and story cards with proper data mapping, cultural indicators, and AI enrichment. This skill provides design system patterns and component guidelines for Indigenous storytelling platforms.
actual_capabilities: Design storyteller card components with cultural context display
Implement AI enrichment patterns for profile enhancement
Apply cultural color meanings and accessibility standards
Create card variants for different display contexts
Build consent and syndication dashboard interfaces
Implement dark mode and responsive design patterns
limitations: Does not generate production code directly
Cultural guidelines specific to Indigenous storytelling context
Database schema examples require Supabase backend

use_cases.title: Build storyteller cards
use_cases.description: Create card components for displaying storyteller profiles with cultural indicators and AI insights.

use_cases.title: Design system guidelines
use_cases.description: Apply color palettes, accessibility standards, and cultural sensitivity patterns to component designs.

use_cases.title: Component standards
use_cases.description: Establish design patterns for AI-enriched content and consent management interfaces in storytelling platforms.

prompt_templates.title: Create storyteller card
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a StorytellerCard component that displays cultural background, elder status, story count, and specialties with proper fallbacks for missing data.

prompt_templates.title: Add AI enrichment
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me how to implement AI enrichment for storyteller profiles including quote extraction, theme expertise, and connection suggestions.

prompt_templates.title: Cultural indicators
prompt_templates.prompt: How should I display traditional territory, cultural affiliations, and language skills on a storyteller profile card?

prompt_templates.title: Consent dashboard
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a consent management dashboard with consent status badges, revocation workflows, and cultural permission indicators.

output_examples.input: Design a featured storyteller card with AI insights
output: Card displays large avatar with elder and featured badges
Featured quote block with story attribution
Theme expertise badges with depth indicators
AI Enhanced indicator with last update timestamp
Action buttons: View Profile, Read Stories, Connect

best_practices: Always show cultural background with traditional territory acknowledgment
Mark AI-generated content clearly with visual indicators
Provide fallback states for missing avatar, bio, and specialty data
Implement dark mode using semantic CSS variables for all colors
anti_patterns: Hardcoding colors instead of using CSS variables
Displaying AI-generated content without indicating its origin
Omitting elder status or cultural context from storyteller cards
Missing accessibility labels on status badges and interactive elements

faq.question: What platforms does this skill support?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code for component design and documentation tasks.

faq.question: What data fields are required for storyteller cards?
faq.answer: Required: display_name, cultural_background, avatar_url. Recommended: story_count, specialties, elder/featured status.

faq.question: Can I integrate with external design systems?
faq.answer: Yes. Patterns use Tailwind CSS conventions but can adapt to any design system with CSS variable mapping.

faq.question: Is user data safe with AI enrichment?
faq.answer: AI content is marked visually. Storytellers can override suggestions. Sacred content is excluded from extraction.

faq.question: Why do my cards look different in dark mode?
faq.answer: Use semantic colors like --background, --card, --foreground instead of hardcoded hex values for proper theme support.

faq.question: How does this compare to generic card components?
faq.answer: Adds cultural sensitivity layers, AI enrichment indicators, and Indigenous storytelling context specific to the platform.
